ddi:var.name: CASE_ID
ddi:var.ddi:labl: Unique respondent identifier

ddi:var.name: GPS_NAC_ADOPTER
ddi:var.ddi:labl: Which survey was completed

ddi:var.name: SURVEY_SOURCE
ddi:var.ddi:labl: Which Survey R Completed

ddi:var.name: HOME
ddi:var.ddi:labl: What type of home do you live in?

ddi:catgry.ddi:labl: Apartment\Condo in a house or a building with 2-4 units
Apartment\Condo in a building with 5 or more units

ddi:var.name: STATE
ddi:var.ddi:labl: Which state do you live in?

ddi:var.name: AGE_BINNED
ddi:var.ddi:labl: What is your age?-Years

ddi:var.name: EDUC_BINNED
ddi:var.ddi:labl: What is the highest level of education you have completed?

ddi:catgry.ddi:labl: Less than High School, or High School \ GED
Some College (1-4 years, no degree), or Associate's degree (including occupational or academic degrees)
Master's Degree (MA, MS, MENG, MSW, etc), or Professional Degree (MD, DDC, JD, etc), or Doctoral Degree (PhD, EdD, etc)

ddi:var.name: F1
ddi:var.ddi:labl: I have personally seen solar panels installed on someone’s home.

ddi:var.name: F2
ddi:var.ddi:labl: I have thought about getting solar panels for my home.

ddi:var.name: TRIG1
ddi:var.ddi:labl: A friend or neighbor has recently installed solar panels.

ddi:var.name: TRIG3
ddi:var.ddi:labl: In the last six months, I have seen or heard advertisements from companies that install solar panels.

ddi:var.name: TRIG2
ddi:var.ddi:labl: My family has recently received advertising or a call from a company that installs solar panels.

ddi:var.name: TRIG4
ddi:var.ddi:labl: In the last six months, I have seen political advertisements about solar policies.

ddi:var.name: N1
ddi:var.ddi:labl: I know more than one person with solar panels on their home.

ddi:var.name: N2
ddi:var.ddi:labl: Several people in my neighborhood have installed solar panels.

ddi:var.name: N3
ddi:var.ddi:labl: I have talked about solar panels with someone who has already installed them on their home.

ddi:var.name: F3
ddi:var.ddi:labl: I’ve heard that it’s possible to lease solar panels instead of buying them.

ddi:var.name: F4
ddi:var.ddi:labl: I have already spoken with a solar company about possibly installing solar panels on my home.

ddi:var.name: CIJM1
ddi:var.ddi:labl: Before buying a new brand, I usually ask someone who has experience with the brand for advice.

ddi:var.name: CIJM2
ddi:var.ddi:labl: Before I buy a new product or service, I often ask acquaintances about their experiences with that product or service.

ddi:var.name: CIJM3
ddi:var.ddi:labl: When considering a new product [OR] service, I usually trust the opinions of friends who have used the product [OR] service.

ddi:var.name: CNS1
ddi:var.ddi:labl: I continuously look for new products and brands.

ddi:var.name: CNS2
ddi:var.ddi:labl: I continuously look for new experiences from new products.

ddi:var.name: CNS4
ddi:var.ddi:labl: I like to visit places where I’m exposed to information about new products and brands.

ddi:var.name: VB1
ddi:var.ddi:labl: Protecting the environment, preserving nature

ddi:var.name: VB2
ddi:var.ddi:labl: Respecting the earth, harmony with other species

ddi:var.name: VB3
ddi:var.ddi:labl: Unity with nature, fitting into nature

ddi:var.name: VA1
ddi:var.ddi:labl: A world at peace, free of war and conflict

ddi:var.name: VA2
ddi:var.ddi:labl: Social justice, correcting injustice, care for the weak

ddi:var.name: VA3
ddi:var.ddi:labl: Equality, equal opportunity for all

ddi:var.name: VT1
ddi:var.ddi:labl: Honoring parents and elders, showing respect

ddi:var.name: VT2
ddi:var.ddi:labl: Family security, safety for loved ones

ddi:var.name: VT3
ddi:var.ddi:labl: Self-discipline, self-restraint, resistance to temptation

ddi:var.name: VE1
ddi:var.ddi:labl: Authority, the right to lead or command

ddi:var.name: VE2
ddi:var.ddi:labl: Influential, having an impact on people and events

ddi:var.name: VE4
ddi:var.ddi:labl: Wealth, material possessions, money

ddi:var.name: VO1
ddi:var.ddi:labl: A varied life, filled with challenge, novelty, and change

ddi:var.name: VO2
ddi:var.ddi:labl: An exciting life, stimulating experiences

ddi:var.name: VO3
ddi:var.ddi:labl: Curious, interested in everything, exploring

ddi:var.name: PN1
ddi:var.ddi:labl: I feel a personal obligation to do my part to move the country to a renewable energy future.

ddi:var.name: PN2
ddi:var.ddi:labl: I feel a personal obligation to do my part to prevent climate change.

ddi:var.name: PN3
ddi:var.ddi:labl: I feel guilty when I waste energy.

ddi:var.name: E2
ddi:var.ddi:labl: Climate change is a serious problem for society.

ddi:var.name: BTE7
ddi:var.ddi:labl: Using solar could protect my family from electricity blackouts.

ddi:var.name: BB1
ddi:var.ddi:labl: If more households get solar panels, environmental quality will improve.

ddi:var.name: BB2
ddi:var.ddi:labl: Solar panels help slow down climate change.

ddi:var.name: BB3
ddi:var.ddi:labl: Having solar panels would be a good way to reduce my environmental impact.

ddi:var.name: BTE8
ddi:var.ddi:labl: Using solar will help protect my family from rising electricity prices in the future.

ddi:var.name: BE13
ddi:var.ddi:labl: Installing solar provides a great return on a family’s investment.

ddi:var.name: BE10
ddi:var.ddi:labl: Using solar would save me money.

ddi:var.name: Co3
ddi:var.ddi:labl: Having solar panels on my home would help meet my family’s needs.

ddi:var.name: BE11
ddi:var.ddi:labl: Solar panels would increase my property value.

ddi:var.name: M3
ddi:var.ddi:labl: Installing solar panels could damage my home.

ddi:var.name: BO15
ddi:var.ddi:labl: I would worry about having solar panels because it would be an unfamiliar experience.

ddi:var.name: BTE9
ddi:var.ddi:labl: Installing solar panels is a risky thing for a household to do.

ddi:var.name: PBC7
ddi:var.ddi:labl: I may not be in my home long enough to get the benefits of investing in solar.

ddi:var.name: PBC9
ddi:var.ddi:labl: The process of getting solar installed is a hassle.

ddi:var.name: M2
ddi:var.ddi:labl: Maintaining solar panels is expensive.

ddi:var.name: PBC3
ddi:var.ddi:labl: Solar panels are still very expensive, even with government incentives.

ddi:var.name: M4
ddi:var.ddi:labl: The prices of solar power keep going down, so it is wise to wait before deciding whether to install it.

ddi:var.name: PBC5
ddi:var.ddi:labl: I can’t afford solar on my family budget.

ddi:var.name: M1
ddi:var.ddi:labl: Solar panel technology will only get better, so it doesn't make sense to get them now.

ddi:var.name: Tru5
ddi:var.ddi:labl: If a solar company tells me how much I would save on my electric bills by installing solar, I would want a second opinion.

ddi:var.name: Tr1
ddi:var.ddi:labl: Before contacting a solar company, I would like to see solar panels up close on someone else’s house.

ddi:var.name: Tr2
ddi:var.ddi:labl: Before considering solar panels, I would want to talk to someone who has solar panels on their home.

ddi:var.name: Tr3
ddi:var.ddi:labl: I would be more interested in solar if there were some way for me to try it out before installing it.

ddi:var.name: Dep1
ddi:var.ddi:labl: Solar panels nowadays have become very dependable.

ddi:var.name: Dep2
ddi:var.ddi:labl: I question whether solar panels actually work as well as promised.

ddi:var.name: Dep3
ddi:var.ddi:labl: I question whether solar panels will last long enough to pay for themselves.

ddi:var.name: M6
ddi:var.ddi:labl: It's too cloudy where I live for solar panels to be effective.

ddi:var.name: Suit1
ddi:var.ddi:labl: At my home, there's no place to put solar panels that would get enough sunlight.

ddi:var.name: Suit2
ddi:var.ddi:labl: It's not sunny enough in my area for solar panels to work well.

ddi:var.name: O3
ddi:var.ddi:labl: I would feel embarrassed to have solar panels on my roof where others can see them.

ddi:var.name: SN1
ddi:var.ddi:labl: People who are important to me would be in favor of installing solar panels.

ddi:var.name: SN4
ddi:var.ddi:labl: My family members would be opposed to getting solar panels.

ddi:var.name: SN5
ddi:var.ddi:labl: Most people who are important to me would support me if I decided to go solar.

ddi:var.name: DV1
ddi:var.ddi:labl: If my neighbors installed solar I would be interested in learning about the costs and savings of their system.

ddi:var.name: DV2
ddi:var.ddi:labl: If a friend installed solar I would be interested in learning about the costs and savings of their system.

ddi:var.name: DV3
ddi:var.ddi:labl: If a company that sells or installs solar panels were talking to people in my neighborhood, I would be interested in talking with a representative.

ddi:var.name: DV4
ddi:var.ddi:labl: If I could get a no-cost assessment of what solar panels could do for my home, I would do it.

ddi:var.name: DV7
ddi:var.ddi:labl: I plan to contact a solar installation company within the next 6 months to discuss installing solar at my home.

ddi:var.name: INT_Q1
ddi:var.ddi:labl: How interested - How solar panel systems work.

ddi:var.name: INT_Q2
ddi:var.ddi:labl: How interested - How to find reputable solar installers in my area.

ddi:var.name: INT_Q3
ddi:var.ddi:labl: How interested -How common solar is in my community.

ddi:var.name: INT_Q4
ddi:var.ddi:labl: How interested -What the options are for leasing solar.

ddi:var.name: INT_Q5
ddi:var.ddi:labl: How interested -How solar can save me money.

ddi:var.name: INT_Q6
ddi:var.ddi:labl: How interested -The environmental benefits of solar.

ddi:var.name: INT_Q7
ddi:var.ddi:labl: How interested -How well solar would work on my house.

ddi:var.name: TR_GOV
ddi:var.ddi:labl: Trust -Government agency website (e.g., Department of Energy)

ddi:var.name: TR_COMP
ddi:var.ddi:labl: Trust -Companies that provide or install solar panels

ddi:var.name: TR_TRADE
ddi:var.ddi:labl: Trust -Solar industry trade organizations

ddi:var.name: TR_UTIL
ddi:var.ddi:labl: Trust -Electric and gas utilities

ddi:var.name: TR_ONLINE
ddi:var.ddi:labl: Trust -Online reviews from other people who have installed solar

ddi:var.name: TR_FRFAM
ddi:var.ddi:labl: Trust -Friends or family

ddi:var.name: TR_NEIGHB
ddi:var.ddi:labl: Trust -Neighbors

ddi:var.name: TR_ENVORG
ddi:var.ddi:labl: Trust -Environmental organizations

ddi:var.name: TR_UNIV
ddi:var.ddi:labl: Trust -University researchers

ddi:var.name: INV_NEIGHFR
ddi:var.ddi:labl: Talk to a neighbor or friend who has solar.

ddi:var.name: INV_PARTY
ddi:var.ddi:labl: Attend an informational solar “party” at a neighbor’s house to learn more.

ddi:var.name: INV_ONLINECUST
ddi:var.ddi:labl: Read online customer testimonials from people who have installed solar.

ddi:var.name: INV_ONLINEVIDEO
ddi:var.ddi:labl: Watch online video testimonials from people who have installed solar.

ddi:var.name: INV_REVIEWS
ddi:var.ddi:labl: Search for online reviews of solar installers on a website like Yelp or Angie’s List.

ddi:var.name: INV_FACEBK
ddi:var.ddi:labl: Visit a Facebook page where solar users answer questions for prospective customers.

ddi:var.name: INV_GOVTWEB
ddi:var.ddi:labl: Visit a government-sponsored website where solar users answer questions for prospective customers.

ddi:var.name: WINTER_NOPV_BINNED
ddi:var.ddi:labl: How much do you spend (or if R has panels now, did you spend prior to getting panels) on electricity in a typical winter month?

ddi:var.name: SUMMER_NOPV_BINNED
ddi:var.ddi:labl: How much do you spend (or if R has panels now, did you spend prior to getting panels) on electricity in a typical summer month?

ddi:var.name: BILLS
ddi:var.ddi:labl: In the past twelve months, would you say your electric bills have decreased, increased, or stayed about the same compared to past years?

ddi:var.name: POWER
ddi:var.ddi:labl: Over the past twelve months, how many times has there been a complete loss of electric power at your home for more than five minutes?

ddi:var.name: STANCE
ddi:var.ddi:labl: When it comes to politics, do you usually think of yourself as liberal, moderate, conservative, or something else?

ddi:var.name: SOCIAL
ddi:var.ddi:labl: How liberal or conservative are you on social issues?

ddi:var.name: ECON
ddi:var.ddi:labl: How liberal or conservative are you on economic issues?

ddi:var.name: CITYYRS_BINNED
ddi:var.ddi:labl: How long have you lived in your current city?-Years

ddi:var.name: HMYRS_1_TEXT
ddi:var.ddi:labl: Approximately how many more years do you expect to live in your current home?-Years:

ddi:var.name: SQFT_BINNED
ddi:var.ddi:labl: Home Living Space (Square Feet)

ddi:var.name: GENDER
ddi:var.ddi:labl: What is your gender?

ddi:var.name: PEOPLE_TOT_3PLUS
ddi:var.ddi:labl: R indicated that a total of 3 or more adults and children live in house

ddi:var.name: HAVE_KIDS
ddi:var.ddi:labl: Whether R reports any children under 18 living in the house

ddi:var.name: EMPLOY_1
ddi:var.ddi:labl: Employed full time

ddi:var.name: EMPLOY_2
ddi:var.ddi:labl: Employed part time

ddi:var.name: EMPLOY_5
ddi:var.ddi:labl: A homemaker

ddi:var.name: RETIRED
ddi:var.ddi:labl: R reports employment status as retired (may have also selected other status options)

ddi:var.name: FINANCIAL
ddi:var.ddi:labl: How would you describe your current financial situation? …

ddi:catgry.ddi:labl: Meet your basic expenses with a little left over for extras
Just meet your basic living expenses
Don't have enough to meet basic expenses

ddi:var.name: INCOME_BINNED
ddi:var.ddi:labl: What is your annual household income before taxes?
